moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. exd5 exd5: Exchanging right away against the French Defense. White has better moves.
moves.4. Bd3 Nf6 5. Nf3 Qe7+ 6. Be3 Ng4 7. Qe2: Black has already provoked dark-squared weaknesses around the White king.
moves.8... Nc6 9. c3 Qxe3+ 10. fxe3: Now there is a weak e pawn to take care of.
moves.10... f5 11. Nbd2 g6 12. g3 Bg7 13. Nb3: The king is in some trouble despite the absence of the queens because of my dark squared bishop.
moves.14... a6 15. Rae1 b6 16. Nbd2 Bb7 17. c4: For an even material game, it is anything but that. I'm about to sweep the board with my well- placed pieces.
moves.18. cxd5 Nb4 19. Ne5 Nxd3+ 20. Nxd3 Bxd5: The king has to step into more trouble to try to protect the undefended knights.
moves.24. Ke2 Bxe3: But this decides the game anyway.
moves.25. Kf3 Rxd3: A piece and an exchange will be lost here and Black resigns. The opening decided this game.
